Consider the following circuit. There is an ideal operational amplifier with a FET in the feedback path. The gate of the FET is grounded. We will be concerned with the operating point and the small-signal behavior of this circuit. So the input voltage \(v_I = V_I + v_i\) and the output voltage \(v_O = V_O + v_o\).
The parameters of the FET are \(K = $Km\)mA/V\(^2\) and \(V_T = $VT\)V.
The resistor's resistance is \(R_S = $R\Omega\).
If we set the input operating-point voltage to \(V_I = $VI\)V, what is the output operating-point voltage \(V_O\), in Volts?
Now that we have an operating point we can determine the response to small signals.
What is the small-signal gain \(v_o/v_i\) of this circuit at the operating point?
